page.title: 04RED DEER
page.content: The principal home of the English Red deer is the Exmoor National Park although there are herds on the nearby Quantocks and in the Lake District.The deer are born on a desolate part of the moors such as the "Chains"in mid June.The hind usually gives birth to only one calf but twins have been known.In October during the{rutting} season the stags can be heard roaring or{"bolving"}as they fight to maintain their ascendancy.The deer's natural food includes wild plants but they also consume farmers' crops and are a pest.High fences are erected to keep them out.Hunting with Staghounds is a popular socisl activity which helps control the deer though some think it cruel.
